Articles.Content:
I assume you were all waiting for me

Already undertaken several missions to the Mun and back and had to build a huge refrigerated warehouse,

to store all the parts of Jebediah, Bill and Bob Kermans who died, advancing Kerbal knowledge.

(well, if we already had a persistent universe from the beginning on, I would now have a spacecraft orbiting the sun, several manned munar stations (spacecraft who got damaged during landing on the mun, but on which our Kermans survived (must be 3-4 at least )) and of course Mun and Kerbin littered from the Debris of spacecraft who didnÂ´t survive

and am now employing bigger and bigger rockets which go up to and beyond the ability of its pilots and of KSP to handle them

btw. is there any hint hidden behind the fact, that the most important parts of the spacecraft (i.e. the engines and fuel tanks) are produced by Jebediah Kerman industries?

And finally ... a pic that illustrates why it is always a good idea to travel (Mun, Kerbin and the sun in conjunction)
That\'s a pretty big ship to be that close to the Mun for stock parts, nice job!

Thanks

Unfortunately the landing stage of that version wasnÂ´t able to land on the Mun yet (its single engine was too weak to successfully stop the fall, something which Jebediah, Bill and Bob soon found out ) ... later (and current) designs employ a little bigger landing craft with 4 engines, which allows me to successfully land on Mun and return to Kerbin

Welcome to the forums! You seem really eager to get right into things.

If you have any questions, concerns or what-have-you feel free to contact your friendly Moderation staff!

Alternatively, the community itself goes way beyond mostly what we can answer!

Your friendly neighborhood bag of bones,

-Drakomis
Welcome to the forums! Have a good time here, and all the other things you wish

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Welcome to the forums! Hope you enjoy your stay.

Also, just a hint: Press F1 to make the HUD\'s go away so you can get better screenshots.
